rules.notes: Corporate income tax rate 6.5%. Alabama follows a factor presence standard. Elective pass-through entity tax available.
Has corporate income tax (0-9.4% graduated) but no individual income tax. No state sales tax. Oil and gas industry has unique tax provisions.
Corporate income tax rate 4.9%. Uses single sales factor apportionment. Transaction privilege tax (TPT) applies to sales.
Corporate income tax rate 1-5.3% graduated. Uses three-factor apportionment with double-weighted sales.

Corporate tax rate 8.84% (franchise tax). $800 minimum franchise tax. Aggressive factor presence nexus standard: $711,538 in sales (2023, adjusted annually), $71,154 in property/payroll, or 25% of total factor. Single sales factor apportionment for most industries. Very aggressive enforcement of economic nexus.
Corporate income tax rate 4.4%. Uses single sales factor apportionment. Factor presence nexus threshold of $500,000 in sales.
Corporate tax rate 7.5%. 10% surtax applies to companies with income over $100M. Officers and directors in state create definite nexus. Factor presence threshold of $500,000 in sales.

Corporate income tax rate 8.7%. Franchise tax required for all entities incorporated in Delaware (annual report + franchise tax). Gross receipts tax of 0.0945%-0.7468% depending on business type. Incorporation alone creates franchise tax nexus. Popular incorporation state due to business-friendly Court of Chancery.

Corporate franchise tax rate 8.25%. Aggressive nexus enforcement. Contractors and coworking spaces create definite nexus. Factor presence nexus standard: $250,000 in DC sales, $50,000 in DC property, or $50,000 in DC payroll.

Corporate income tax rate 5.5% (applied to federal taxable income apportioned to FL). No individual income tax. C corporations with income apportioned to FL must file. $50,000 exemption from corporate income tax.
Corporate income tax rate 5.75%. Single sales factor apportionment. Factor presence nexus based on property, payroll, or sales thresholds in the state.

Corporate income tax rate 4.4-6.4% graduated. General excise tax (GET) of 4-4.5% applies broadly to gross receipts (functions similarly to a gross receipts tax but is technically a privilege tax). Three-factor apportionment.
Corporate income tax rate 5.8%. Single sales factor apportionment. Factor presence nexus threshold applies.

Corporate income tax rate 7% plus 2.5% personal property replacement tax (effective 9.5%). Franchise tax being phased out (fully repealed by 2024). Factor presence nexus. Single sales factor apportionment.
Corporate income tax (adjusted gross income tax) rate 4.9%. Single sales factor apportionment. Factor presence nexus standard applies.
Corporate income tax rate transitioning to flat 5.5% (was graduated 5.5-8.4%). Single sales factor apportionment. Factor presence nexus standard applies.
Corporate income tax rate 4% plus 3% surtax on income over $50,000 (effective 7% over $50K). Three-factor apportionment with double-weighted sales.
Corporate income tax rate 5% flat. Single sales factor apportionment. Limited liability entity tax (LLET) of 0.095% of gross receipts or 0.75% of gross profits applies as a minimum tax.
Corporate income tax rate 3.5-7.5% graduated. Franchise tax of $1.50 per $1,000 of taxable capital up to $300,000 and $3 per $1,000 thereafter. Single sales factor apportionment.
Corporate income tax rate 3.5-8.93% graduated. Single sales factor apportionment. Factor presence nexus standard applies.
Corporate income tax rate 8.25%. Digital advertising gross revenues tax enacted (first in US, applied to companies with >$100M global revenue). Single sales factor apportionment.

Corporate excise tax rate 8% on net income. $456 minimum excise tax. Aggressive nexus enforcement; contractors create definite nexus. Factor presence nexus: $500,000 in sales. Single sales factor apportionment. 4% surtax on income over $1M (millionaire tax).
Corporate income tax rate 6%. Single sales factor apportionment. Factor presence nexus standard applies. City income taxes also apply in some municipalities (e.g., Detroit).
Corporate franchise tax rate 9.8%. Single sales factor apportionment. Factor presence nexus: property >$50,000, payroll >$50,000, or sales >$500,000, or 25% of total property/payroll/sales.
Corporate income tax rate 5% (flat, simplified from graduated). Franchise tax of $2.50 per $1,000 of capital, $25 minimum. Three-factor apportionment with double-weighted sales.
Corporate income tax rate 4%. Single sales factor apportionment. $50,000 income exemption for small corporations. Factor presence nexus standard applies.
Corporate income tax rate 6.75%. No sales tax. Three-factor apportionment. Factor presence nexus standard applies.
Corporate income tax rate 5.58-7.25% (being reduced over several years). Single sales factor apportionment. Factor presence nexus standard applies.

No corporate or individual income tax. Commerce Tax applies to businesses with Nevada gross revenue exceeding $4 million (rate varies by industry, 0.051%-0.331%). Modified business tax on wages also applies. Popular incorporation state.

Business Profits Tax (BPT) rate 7.5% on business income over $50,000. Business Enterprise Tax (BET) of 0.55% on enterprise value tax base (compensation + interest + dividends). No general sales tax. No individual income tax on wages. BET can be credited against BPT.

Corporation Business Tax rate 6.5-11.5% graduated (9% base + 2.5% surtax on income >$1M). Aggressive nexus enforcement; contractors create definite nexus. Single sales factor apportionment. Factor presence nexus: $100,000 in NJ receipts.

Corporate income tax rate 4.8-5.9% graduated. Gross receipts tax (GRT) of ~5-9% (combined state/local) applies to most transactions but is a transaction tax, not a traditional gross receipts tax on all revenue. Single sales factor apportionment.

Corporation franchise tax rate 6.5% (7.25% for companies with income >$5M). Fixed dollar minimum tax based on NY receipts ($25-$200,000). Incorporation in NY creates franchise tax nexus. Very aggressive nexus enforcement: officers, contractors, coworking all create definite nexus. Single sales factor apportionment. NYC also imposes a separate corporate tax (8.85%).

Corporate income tax rate 2.5% (being phased down toward 0% by 2030). Franchise tax of $1.50 per $1,000 of largest tax base (capital stock, surplus, undivided profits, or 55% of appraised value of property). Single sales factor apportionment. Factor presence nexus: $50,000 in property, payroll, or sales or 25% of total.
Corporate income tax rate 1.41-4.31% graduated. Three-factor apportionment with double-weighted sales. Factor presence nexus standard applies. Low rates make compliance relatively inexpensive.

No traditional corporate income tax. Commercial Activity Tax (CAT) is a gross receipts tax: 0.26% on gross receipts over $1 million (being restructured with higher threshold). $150 minimum tax for gross receipts $150,000-$1M. Individual income tax applies to pass-through income. CAT nexus threshold: $500,000 in Ohio taxable gross receipts.
Corporate income tax rate 4%. Franchise tax of $1.25 per $1,000 of capital allocated or apportioned to Oklahoma. Three-factor apportionment with enhanced sales weight.

Corporate income/excise tax rate 6.6-7.6%. Corporate Activity Tax (CAT) is a gross receipts tax: 0.57% on commercial activity over $1 million (after 35% subtraction for cost of goods sold or labor). $250 minimum tax. No sales tax. Single sales factor apportionment.

Corporate net income tax rate being reduced (was 9.99%, phasing down to 4.99% by 2031). Aggressive nexus enforcement; contractors create definite nexus. Single sales factor apportionment. Philadelphia also imposes a city business income and receipts tax.
Corporate income tax rate 7%. $400 minimum tax. Single sales factor apportionment. Factor presence nexus standard applies.

Corporate income tax rate 5%. Single sales factor apportionment. License fee (similar to franchise tax) based on capital stock and paid-in surplus, being phased out. Factor presence nexus standard applies.

No corporate or individual income tax. No business income tax of any kind. Sales tax applies. Physical presence may create sales/use tax nexus. Origin of Wayfair v. South Dakota economic nexus case for sales tax.

Corporate excise (income) tax rate 6.5%. Franchise tax of 0.25% of net worth or tangible property (greater of the two), $100 minimum. No individual income tax (Hall tax on interest/dividends fully phased out as of 2021). Single sales factor apportionment. Factor presence nexus: $500,000 in sales, $50,000 in property, $50,000 in payroll, or 25% of total.

No corporate or individual income tax. Franchise (margin) tax: 0.375% for retail/wholesale, 0.75% for other entities on total revenue minus deductions (COGS, compensation, or 30% standard deduction). $1,230,000 no-tax-due threshold (2024). Incorporation in Texas creates franchise tax nexus. Single sales factor apportionment equivalent.
Corporate income tax rate 4.65% (flat). $100 minimum tax. Single sales factor apportionment. Factor presence nexus standard applies.
Corporate income tax rate 6-8.5% graduated. $300 minimum tax. Three-factor apportionment with double-weighted sales. Factor presence nexus standard applies.

Corporate income tax rate 6%. Single sales factor apportionment. Factor presence nexus standard applies. BPOL (Business, Professional, and Occupational License) tax applies at the local level based on gross receipts.

No corporate or individual income tax. Business & Occupation (B&O) tax is a gross receipts tax with rates varying by classification (0.138%-3.3%; most common: 0.471% retailing, 0.484% services, 0.138% manufacturing). No deduction for COGS or expenses. Nexus threshold for B&O: physical presence or >$100,000 in receipts from WA sources. Capital gains tax of 7% on gains >$270,000 (contested).
Corporate net income tax rate 6.5%. Franchise tax being phased out. Three-factor apportionment with double-weighted sales. Factor presence nexus standard applies.
Corporate income/franchise tax rate 7.9%. Single sales factor apportionment. Factor presence nexus standard applies. Economic nexus threshold of $100,000 in sales for sales tax.

No corporate or individual income tax. No business income tax of any kind. Sales tax applies. Popular state for LLC formation due to privacy protections and no income tax. Mineral extraction taxes apply to mining/oil/gas industries.
